member.name: M:_24212C_DLL.TimeConvert.convertTime(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convert time from 24 Format to 12 Format. This function can throw a _24212C-DLL.InvalidTimeException because the time may be invalid, but will move on if it is given a is a valid time.
member.param: This is the time in 24 Format that will be converted. This must include a : between the hours and the minutes, or else the conversion will fail.
Set this to true if you want to force the conversion without throwing InvalidTimeExceptions.

member.name: M:_24212C_DLL.TimeConvert.convertTimeFromTwelve(_24212C_DLL.TwelveFormatTime)
member.summary: Convert the time from the 12 time format to the 24 time format.
member.param: This is the 12 time format to be converted from.

member.name: T:_24212C_DLL.TimeConvert.InputFormat
member.summary: This is used in convertTime() to tell it which type of time to convert from and which to convert to.

member.name: M:_24212C_DLL.TwelveFormatTime.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,_24212C_DLL.TwelveFormatTime.AMPMTime)
member.summary: Creates a new TwelveFormatTime for use with ConvertTime.
member.param: The integer of hours to be used (Must be double digits, 3 would turn into 03).
The integer of minutes to be used (Must also be double digits).
This is the enum for if the time is in the AM or the PM.

member.name: P:_24212C_DLL.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:_24212C_DLL.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:_24212C_DLL.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.
